data: This is the about page! This page is shown on the navbar.

Haven‚Äôt installed the script yet? No worries, this guide will walk you step by step through the entire setup process, from downloading the resource to getting it fully functional on your server. Follow each step to ensure a smooth installation.
data.installation-guide#Installation Guide:
Download the latest release of next-flashbang (script) AND the latest release of next-flashbang-item (model).
Unpack the releases and remove the release tag so only next-flashbang AND next-flashbang-item remain.
Make sure you add them to your resources.cfg or server.cfg for them to auto-start.
IMPORTANT: Make sure these resources start AFTER ox_inventory!So, it should look like this:
ensure ox_inventory
ensure next-flashbang-item
ensure next-flashbang
‚ö†Ô∏è Disclaimer: Do not edit the resource name, unless you are willing to adapt the script to it yourself.
Some functions, like exports, depend on a set resource name. The current name is preconfigured.
Navigate to the installation folder
Here, you'll find a premade config to paste into your ox_inventory/data/weapons.lua.
Premade item images are also included ‚Äî drag these to web/images.ox_inventory/data/weapons.lua should look like this:
-- ...weapons
['WEAPON_FLASHBANG'] = {
label = 'K-J4 Flashbang',
category = 'weapons',
weight = 600,
throwable = true,
anim = { 'melee@holster', 'unholster', 200, 'melee@holster', 'holster', 600 },
}

Configure to your own liking
All files within the config folder are easy to modify to your needs.
Changing the src folder contents is only advised if you are an experienced developer.
Have fun!
The resource is now ready to use!

/.title: Next Extend | Secure & Optimized FiveM Resources

data: Welcome to the official documentation for Next Extend ‚Äî a curated collection of optimized, secure, and immersive FiveM resources, crafted for high performance, realism, and modern roleplay experiences.
data.our-focus#Our Focus:
We build systems that:
‚ö° Prioritize client & server performance
üîå Support modern inventory and framework standards (Ox, ESX)
üîÑ Sync cleanly between clients with minimal overhead
üß∞ Are modular, well-documented, and easy to extend
data.featured-projects#Featured Projects: Resource	Description	next-flashbang	The most optimized flashbang system for FiveM	next-kevlar	Advanced modular armor plater carrier system	next-scoreboard	Coming soon!
data.contributing#Contributing: We welcome contributions! Whether it's bug fixes, new features, or suggestions ‚Äî feel free to open issues or submit pull requests.Please follow our contribution guidelines (coming soon) to keep things clean and consistent.
data.license#License: All resources in this organization are released under the MIT License unless stated otherwise.

data: Haven‚Äôt installed the script yet? No worries, this guide will walk you step by step through the entire setup process, from downloading the resource to getting it fully functional in your server. Follow each step to ensure a smooth installation.
data.installation-guide#Installation Guide:
Download the latest release
Unpack the release and remove the release tag so only next-kevlar remains.
Make sure you add it to your resources.cfg or server.cfg for it to auto-start.
IMPORTANT: Make sure this resource starts AFTER ox_inventory!So, it should look like this:
ensure ox_inventory
ensure next-kevlar
‚ö†Ô∏è Disclaimer: Do not edit the resource name, unless you are willing to adapt the script to it yourself.
Some functions, like exports, depend on a set resource name. The current name is preconfigured.
Navigate to the installation folder
Here, you'll find a premade config to paste into your ox_inventory/data/items.lua.
Premade item images are also included ‚Äî drag these to web/images.ox_inventory/data/items.lua should look like this:
-- ...items
['heavypc'] = {
label = 'Heavy Plate Carrier',
description = 'Modular vest with 2 plate slots.',
weight = 1500,
stack = false,
consume = 0,
client = {
export = 'next-kevlar.useVest'
},
buttons = {{
label = "Manage Plates",
action = function(slot)
exports['next-kevlar']:managePlates(slot)
end
}}
},

['lightpc'] = {
label = 'Light Plate Carrier',
description = 'Modular vest with a plate slot.',
weight = 1000,
stack = false,
consume = 0,
client = {
export = 'next-kevlar.useVest'
},
buttons = {{
label = "Manage Plates",
action = function(slot)
exports['next-kevlar']:managePlates(slot)
end
}}
},

['lightplate'] = {
label = 'Light Plate',
weight = 250,
stack = false,
description = 'A light plate, made of Polyethylene'
},

['heavyplate'] = {
label = 'Heavy Plate',
weight = 500,
stack = false,
description = 'A heavy plate, made of Ceramics'
},

['brokenplate'] = {
label = 'Broken Plate',
weight = 500,
stack = false,
description = 'This plate has shattered!'
},

Configure to your own liking
All files within the config folder are easy to modify to your needs.
Changing the src folder contents is only advised if you are an experienced developer.
Have fun!
The resource is now ready to use. You can add the items to shops or give them via commands.

data.standalone-for-frameworks-other-than-esx:
You can use this export to trigger the flashbang in your framework.
exports['next-flashbang']:onFlashbang()
